intro: Aconitum napellus subsp. formosum, commonly known as the Japanese aconite, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It features showy, blue to purple spires of flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has dark green, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it should be handled with care.
